SENT.plain: Achondroplasia and thanatophoric dysplasia are human chondrodysplasias caused by mutations in the fibroblast growth factor receptor 3 (FGFR3) gene
We have developed an immortalized human chondrocyte culture model to study the regulation of chondrocyte functions
One control and eight mutant chondrocytic lines expressing different FGFR3 heterozygous mutations were obtained
FGFR3 signaling pathways were modified in the mutant lines as revealed by the constitutive activation of the STAT pathway and an increased level of P21(WAF1/CIP1) protein
This model will be useful for the study of FGFR3 function in cartilage studies and future therapeutic approaches in chondrodysplasias
